intro: Xanthoxerampellia chacoensis, commonly known as the Chaco golden tree, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly the Chaco region of Paraguay and Argentina. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, branched structure and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in complex inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features such as thick, waxy leaves. Xanthoxerampellia chacoensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
